intro: Uncinia urvillei, commonly known as the Urville's hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Uncinia urvillei is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
